TopicTitle: More things to do to your rocket via EVA

Articles.Content:
I want more things to do via EVA, like for example...

I want to replace a solar panel with a one that generates better electricity (or replace a broken panel), so I put it in my rocket and dock, then EVA to the solar panel, and start to repair or replace it.

And etcetra.
You'd like Kerbal Attachment System then

I think repairing damaged solar panels and landing gear via EVA is already implemented. I never use it, my landings are either soft enough not to damage anything or hard enough that solar panels and landing gear are the least of my worries.
Landing gear is repairable, don't think solar panels are though.
Maybe I'm thinking of deploying them on a ship with dead batteries.
Indeed you are. Many a ship has been saved by getting close with a doner craft and transferring over solar panels that some stupid guy forgot to put on in the first place.

You'd like Kerbal Attachment System then

Second this. It's amazing.

Not just repairing, but adding things too. And removing. Let's say I think that some parts of my space station (let's say...some struts) are un neccessary at a point, so I want to EVA and remove them.

Or I think my orbiting vessel is in danger of coming back to earth and it has no fuel, so I want to EVA and add some parachutes to it.

You'd like Kerbal Attachment System then

I feel this is one of those mods that would make a lot of sense within the stock game. The Dev's have even said they wanted to check it out, hopefully so they can implement at least something like it.
Would be interesting at some point for the kerbals to be able to reallocate fuel ducts, or even conduct a refuel from 2 separate sources using a fuel duct or similar, inland.

Very interesting and good mod indeed, but as im playing career mode, are the parts available from the beginning in career mode?

Very interesting and good mod indeed, but as im playing career mode, are the parts available from the beginning in career mode?

No, they get unlocked gradually like any other mod. But the functionality, like grabbing things, is obviously available from the start. Pipes are in Fuel Systems (same node as stock fuel lines) and all the other parts are KAS-specific i.e. have no stock analogue.
